name: Writ 100
description: Prepares students to write in college by focusing on writing as process for a variety of contexts and audiences. Develops information literacy, awareness of conventions, skills of inquiry, exploration, and argumentation. Includes frequent conferencing with instructors and multimodal writing presented in ePortfolios.

name: Writ 101
description: Prepares students to write in college by focusing on writing as process for a variety of contexts and audiences. Develops information literacy, awareness of conventions, skills of inquiry, exploration, and argumentation. Includes mulitmodal writing presented in ePortfolios.

name: Writ 102
description: Writing processes, skills on inquiry, exploration, and argumentation, with special emphasis on research, information literacy, and writing for a variety of contexts and audiences. Includes multimodal writing presented in ePortfolios.

name: Liba 102
description: This name is a seminar restricted to first-year students. Topics will vary among sections. Emphasis is placed on the development of studentsâ€™ writing, oral communication, and critical-thinking skills. Students may receive credit for both Liba 102 and Writ 102.

name: Hon 101
description: Honors core name. Equivalent to first-year writing I. Required of honors graduates.

name: Hon 102
description: Honors core name. Equivalent to first-year writing II. Required of honors graduates.

name: Engl 223
description: Survey of American Literature to the Civil War.

name: Engl 224
description: Survey of American Literature since the Civil War.

name: Engl 225
description: Survey of British Literature to the 18th Century.

name: Engl 226
description: Survey of British Literature since the Romantic Period.

name: Math 261
description: Limits, continuity, and differentiation of functions of one real variable. Includes optimization and antiderivatives.

name: Math 262
description: Definite and indefinite integrals, volumes, arc length, and improper integrals.

name: Math 263
description: Sequences and series, parametric/polar curves, vectors, and vector-valued functions.

name: Math 267
description: This name covers differential and integral calculus with an emphasis on business applications. The name meets twice weekly, with other work completed online.

name: Math 301
description: Counting principles, mathematical induction, relations and functions, and graph theory.

name: Math 302
description: Elementary group theory with applications to modular arithmetic, public key encryption, Polya enumeration, and coding theory.

name: Math 375
description: Basic concepts and methods of statistics, including descriptive statistics, probability, distributions, sampling, confidence intervals, hypothesis testing, and linear regression.

name: Math 401
description: Explores counting methods, Ramsey theory, combinatorial designs, graph theory, matroid theory, and other advanced combinatorics topics.

name: Math 319
description: Linear algebra covering vectors, matrices, determinants, linear transformations, and vector spaces.

name: Phys 211
description: This name is the first part of a two-semester calculus-based treatment of introductory physics. Topics include Newtonian mechanics, energy, rotational motion, fluids, oscillations and waves. Of the courses Phys 107, Phys 211, and Phys 213, only one can be counted toward a degree.

name: Phys 212
description: This name is the second part of a two-semester calculus-based treatment of introductory physics. Topics include electricity, magnetism, electromagnetic waves and optics. Of the courses Phys 108, Phys 212, and Phys 214, only one can be counted toward a degree.

name: Phys 221
description: Laboratory experiments coordinated with lecture topics in Phys 211.

name: Phys 222
description: Laboratory experiments coordinated with lecture topics in Phys 212.

name: Chem 105
description: This name covers atomic and molecular structure, stoichiometry, solutions, physical properties of gases, liquids, and solids, chemical bonding, kinetics, thermodynamics and equilibrium, acid-base chemistry and the descriptive chemistry of the elements.

name: Bisc 160
description: Biology I: cells, genetics, and evolution. For majors and pre-professional students.

name: Bisc 162
description: Biology II: development, anatomy, ecology, biodiversity.

name: Upper-Level Biology Placeholder
description: Placeholder for 300-level or above biology elective.

name: Upper-Level Geology Placeholder
description: Placeholder for 300-level or above geology elective.

name: Spch 102
description: Fundamentals of organizing, preparing, and delivering speeches in a variety of public forums.

name: Spch 105
description: Students in this name prepare the speech outline and give frequent performances in business situations requiring effective communicative practices.

name: Social Science Option A
description: Example social science name option (e.g., anthropology, economics, political science, psychology, or sociology).

name: Social Science Option B
description: Another social science name option from the approved categories.

name: Humanities Option A
description: Example humanities name option. May include courses from classics, English, history, modern languages, philosophy, religion, African American studies, gender studies, or southern studies.

name: ElE 235
description: Introduction to electrical engineering concepts and lab work.

name: ElE 236
description: Continuation of electrical engineering principles and hands-on experimentation.

name: Econ 101
description: Primer for students who wish to have basic economic literacy, understand different economic concepts and policies and develop critical thinking skills.

name: Econ 202
description: The nature of economics, economic concepts, and institutions; the role of the price system in directing the production of goods and services; distribution of income; and comparative economic systems.

name: Econ 203
description: Resources and goals of the economy; national income; unemployment; money and banking; fiscal and monetary policy; contemporary problems; economic growth; and international economics.

name: Econ 230
description: Statistical decision making, parameters, probability, sampling, inference, tests, comparative experiments, linear correlation, and time series analysis.

name: Phil 102
description: Students will examine the moral dilemmas professionals face as a consequence of their special training, skills, and work-related duties.

name: Phil 103
description: Principles and methods of sound reasoning, emphasizing analysis of everyday arguments.

name: Phil 104
description: This name introduces students to major ethical questions in politics and society, examining fundamental arguments on issues such as health care, advertising, pornography, abortion, animal testing, and immigration.

name: Phil 105
description: This name introduces students to classic philosophical debates through popular fantasy role-playing games.

name: Thea 201
description: Appreciation of the theatre as a performance art; developing perceptive audience standards through demonstrations of the unique characteristics of theatre.

name: Thea 202
description: This name introduces students to major methods of film analysis and important moments in cinema history, while offering a behind-the-scenes look at how films are made.
